info: In Spanish, the present tense is used to describe actions or situations that are currently happening, habitual actions, or general truths. The conjugation of verbs in the present tense varies based on the subject pronoun (I, you, he/she/it, we, you all, they).
native_answer: I  cook most of the time
prompt: Yo ______ la mayor parte del tiempo
answer: Yo cocino la mayor parte del tiempo
audio_dir: Yo cocino la mayor parte del tiempo

info: In Spanish, the present tense is used to describe actions or situations that are currently happening, habitual actions, or general truths. The conjugation of verbs in the present tense varies based on the subject pronoun (I, you, he/she/it, we, you all, they).

answer: Tú cocinas la mayor parte del tiempo
